summary: A vulnerability in the kubelet component of Kubernetes allows a user who can create pods on a Windows node to escalate privileges to LocalSystem. This is caused by a flaw in the way the kubelet handles volume mounts. An attacker can create a malicious pod that mounts a sensitive directory from the host, and then use that to gain control of the host. This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.29.4, 1.28.9, 1.27.13, and 1.26.16.
details: A vulnerability in the kubelet component of Kubernetes allows a user who can create pods on a Windows node to escalate privileges to LocalSystem. This is caused by a flaw in the way the kubelet handles volume mounts. An attacker can create a malicious pod that mounts a sensitive directory from the host, and then use that to gain control of the host. This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.29.4, 1.28.9, 1.27.13, and 1.26.16.

summary: A vulnerability in the Kubernetes API server allows an attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a flaw in the way the API server handles requests with a large number of labels. An attacker can send a specially crafted request that will cause the API server to consume a large amount of memory, leading to a crash. This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.28.4, 1.27.8, 1.26.11, and 1.25.15.

summary: A vulnerability in the Kubernetes API server allows an attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a flaw in the way the API server handles requests with a large number of `matchExpressions` in a label selector. An attacker can send a specially crafted request that will cause the API server to consume a large amount of CPU, leading to a denial of service. This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.28.3, 1.27.7, 1.26.10, and 1.25.15.

This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.28.3, 1.27.7, 1.26.10, and 1.25.15.

summary: A vulnerability in the Kubernetes API server allows an attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a flaw in the way the API server handles requests with a large number of `matchFields` in a field selector. An attacker can send a specially crafted request that will cause the API server to consume a large amount of CPU, leading to a denial of service. This vulnerability is patched in versions 1.28.3, 1.27.7, 1.26.10, and 1.25.15.
